subclassFeature.name: The Empire

entries: It is our homes, our families, our comrades in arms. It is our pride, our honor, our strength. And so, today, as we fight for its defense and its very existence. For our people! For our empire!

Your patron is the strength of your home and the conviction of its people, as you travel and fight in the name of a noble house, state, or even country. Your magic might be a gift from a court, monarch, or some other high ranking offical of your empire whose power allows them to bestow these boons upon you.

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: The Empire lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you.

entries.caption: Empire Expanded Spells
rows: {@spell create food and water}, {@spell crusader's mantle}
{@spell aura of purity}, {@spell otiluke's resilient sphere}

subclassFeature.name: Imperial Emissary
entries: You're a loyal steward of your empire, either as a diplomat or as a retainer. You choose when you gain this feature:

entries.name: Diplomat
entries: You learn two languages of your choice. You also gain proficiency in the {@skill Persuasion} and {@skill Insight} skills if you don't already have them. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses either of these proficiencies.

entries.name: Retainer
entries: You gain proficiency with medium and heavy armour. You also gain proficiency in the {@skill Intimidation} skill if you don't already have it, and your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses it.

subclassFeature.name: Radiant Decree
entries: You deliver the will of your empire, swift and true. You learn the {@spell word of radiance|XGE} cantrip, which counts as a warlock cantrip for you but doesn't count against the number of cantrips you know.

When you cast {@spell word of radiance|XGE}, you can target a creature that you can see within 60 feet of you, causing the burning radiance caused by the spell to erupt from it, instead of erupting from you. You can decide if the target is affected by the spell when you cast it this way.
Allied creatures in range of {@spell word of radiance|XGE} gain temporary hit points equal to your proficiency bonus, which last until the start of your next turn.
Starting at 3rd level, you can add your Charisma modifier to the damage of {@spell word of radiance|XGE}.

subclassFeature.name: Exalted Emissary
entries: You gain the means to hold sway over the battlefield. You gain one of the following benefits based on your choice at 1st level:

entries.name: Diplomat
entries: As a reaction when you roll initiative, you can choose another willing creature within 30 feet of you and cast {@spell sanctuary} on it without expending a spell slot.

entries.name: Retainer
entries: As a reaction when you roll initiative, you can choose another willing creature within 30 feet of you and cast {@spell heroism} on it without expending a spell slot. The spell doesn't require concentration when you cast it this way.
Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Empowered Decree
entries: The range of the burning radiance caused by word of radiance increases to 10 feet, and creatures that succeed on their saving throw against it take half as much damage from the spell.

subclassFeature.name: Voice of the Empire
entries: You speak the will of your empire into being. You can cast either {@spell divine word} or {@spell power word pain|XGE} without expending a spell slot.
You can cast either spell once, and regain your ability to do so when you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Book of Law
entries: You can cast any of the spells from your expanded spells list of 2nd-level or lower without expending a spell slot. You don't need to know the spell to cast it this way. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.
When you reach 11th level, you can use this feature twice before you must finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Cultured Citizen
entries: You gain proficiency with one artisan tool, one gaming set, and one musical instrument of your choice, and can use any of them as a spellcasting focus for your warlock spells.
Additionally, you have advantage on Intelligence ({@skill History}) checks you make to recall information about your empire.

optionalfeature.name: Guardian Ancestors
entries: You can cast {@spell spirit guardians} twice using warlock spell slots. You regain the ability to do so again when you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Martial Authority
entries: When you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn, you can cast {@spell word of radiance|XGE} as a bonus action.
You can do so a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Seat of Power
entries: You can cast {@spell mighty fortress|XGE} without expending a spell slot or requiring material components. When you cast the spell this way, the fortress lasts for 30 days, and you must wait 30 days before being able to cast the spell this way again.
Casting this spell this on the same spot once every 30 days for a year makes the fortress permanent.

optionalfeature.name: Token of Authority
entries: When the wearer of you talisman fails a Charisma ability check and uses your Pact of the Talisman to gain a bonus {@dice d4} to the roll, you can roll an additional {@dice d4} and use the higher of the two.
